titleStmt.title: V. B. Young et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG4684

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: To His Excellency Thos E Bramlett Governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky. Your We the undersigned Citizens of the County of Bath would respectfully represent unto your Excellency, that at the March Term of the Bath Circuit Court 1861. there was a Judgment obtained against John Stewart of this County for the sum of $30 for a breach of the peace. We would State that the Judgment was obtained agst Mr Stewart in his absence, and that the Judgmt was erroneous, as there was other parties concerned in said breach of the peace and Mr Stewart was only a witness to the affray. We would therefore in view of these facts petition your Excellency to remit said fine, as we deem the facts sufficient to warrant a remission. Owingsville Ky March 14th 1864

V. B. Young C B C C
H M. Butcher
Toliver Anderson
Wm H McBee
Garret Hendrix
Cornelious Anderson
Jos T Swetnam
S. V. Brother
J G Here
John Doyle
Daniel Harper,
Josel faggatt
E. Williams
Wm W. Cartmill
William Sexton
J T Honerman
G W Coyle
Eli W. Fleming
E. Brady
W. N. Arnett
John Biggers
J. J. Fleming
Thomas Barber jr
Jno G. Grimsley
Davis Butler
John Dickin

Bath Co
Refused
Tho E Bramlette
64
